metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2898 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
There is a null-pointer-dereference flaw found in f2fs_write_end_io in fs/f2fs/data.c in the Linux kernel. This flaw allows a local privileged user to cause a denial of service problem. It was discovered that a race condition existed in the f2fs file system in the Linux kernel, leading to a null pointer dereference vulnerability. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious f2fs image that, when mounted and operated on, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2898` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sbeattie> proposed patch is "f2fs: fix to avoid NULL pointer dereference f2fs_write_end_io()"
